001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003/**
004 * This interface defines the behavior of bit vectors, i.e.,
005 * fixed-sized vectors with single bit elements.
006 * This is similar to the standard Java class {@link java.util.BitSet}, which
007 * implements variable-sized vectors and additional functionality.
008 * 
009 * @author WB
010 *
011 */
012public interface BitVector {
013        
014        /**
015         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
016         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
017         * @param i the element index
018         * @return as described
019         */
020        public boolean get(int i);
021        
022        /**
023         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
024         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
025         * @param i the element index
026         * @param val a boolean value
027         */
028        public default void set(int i, boolean val) {
029                if (val) 
030                        this.set(i);
031                else
032                        this.unset(i);
033        }
034        
035        /**
036         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
037         * @param i the element index
038         */
039        public void set(int i);
040        
041        /**
042         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
043         * @param i the element index
044         */
045        public void unset(int i);
046        
047        /**
048         * Sets all element values to 1.
049         */
050        public void setAll();
051        
052        /**
053         * Sets all element values to 0.
054         */
055        public void unsetAll();
056        
057        /**
058         * Returns the length of this bit vector.
059         * @return the length of this bit vector
060         */
061        public int getLength();
062        
063        /**
064         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code byte} array.
065         * Bit-value 0 maps to byte value 0x00, value 1 maps to 0xFF.
066         * @return a {@code byte} array
067         */
068        public default byte[] toByteArray() {
069                byte[] bytes = new byte[this.getLength()];
070                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
071                        if (get(i)) {
072                                bytes[i] = (byte) 0xFF;
073                        }
074                }
075                return bytes;
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Returns the contents of this bit vector as a {@code boolean} array.
080         * Bit-value 0 maps to false, value 1 maps to true.
081         * @return a {@code boolean} array
082         */
083        public default boolean[] toBooleanArray() {
084                boolean[] bools = new boolean[this.getLength()];
085                for (int i = 0; i < bools.length; i++) {
086                        bools[i] = get(i);
087                }
088                return bools;
089        }
090        
091        // static factory methods -----------------------------------------------
092        
093        /**
094         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
095         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code byte}
096         * array. Each byte element b is interpreted as 0/false
097         * if b = 0 and 1/true otherwise.
098         * 
099         * @param bytes an array of byte values
100         * @return a new bit vector
101         */
102        public static BitVector from(byte[] bytes) {
103                return new BitVector64(bytes);
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
108         * {@link BitVector64} from the specified {@code boolean}
109         * array, setting elements to 0/false or 1/true.
110         * 
111         * @param bools an array of boolean values
112         * @return a new bit vector
113         */
114        public static BitVector from(boolean[] bools) {
115                return new BitVector64(bools);
116        }
117        
118        /**
119         * Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
120         * {@link BitVector64} with the specified length.
121         * Elements are initialized to 0/false.
122         * 
123         * @param length the length of the bit vector
124         * @return a new bit vector
125         */
126        public static BitVector create(int length) {
127                return new BitVector64(length);
128        }
129
130}
